article_title: Making A Difference: Susan Farrell practices the 'ministry of availability'
article_text:
Our annual "Making a Difference" series, which highlights the work of everyday people doing extraordinary work in the community, continues today. Readers nominated dozens of individuals whose work is improving the lives of others.

Sunday: Nurse, minister breathe new life into “Camp on the Hill.”

Today: Susan Farrell practices the 'ministry of availability'

Tuesday: Girl Scouts read to blind elderly long after fulfilling their service requirement.

Online: Look for stories and photos of people making a difference at Richmond.com.

og.description: With her arms around a girl in a Mickey Mouse T-shirt, Susan Farrell led a dozen other children in front of her in reciting most of Galatians 5:22-23: “But the fruit of the spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness and self-control.”
